function step_length (in rec_obj, in S, in Cr, in Cm, in Ep, in Epp, in u)
 % step_length calculates optimal steps alpha and beta by minimizing |c-Se(i+1| norm for next step e(i+1)=e(i) + a inv(S'(SS'+uI))(c-Se(i))

Function Documentation

function step_length ( in  rec_obj,
in  S,
in  Cr,
in  Cm,
in  Ep,
in  Epp,
in  u 
)

% step_length calculates optimal steps alpha and beta by minimizing |c-Se(i+1| norm for next step e(i+1)=e(i) + a inv(S'(SS'+uI))(c-Se(i))

Parameters:
S - sensitivity matrix
Cr - vector of capacitances to be measured for current estimation of Ep
Cm - vector of measured capacitances
Ep - current estimation of permittivity distribution (column vector)
Epp - previous estimation of permittivity distribution (column vector)
u - Thikonov regularization factor for matrix pseudo inverse
Return values:
alpha,beta optimal step lengths
